summary:
My ambition is to help companies achieve a perfect customer experience of their products in all touch points

Skills:
- Product data management / Data asset management / integrations
- Solution architect / information analyst / team lead / scrum master

Specialties:
- inRiver PIM / Bynder DAM expert
- ETIM/GS1 product classifications
- B2B/B2C integration solutions

Strong focus on quality & results

Expertise in retail, wholesale & manufacturing

projects.title: Kawasaki Motors Europe PIM implementation
projects.description:
Kawasaki started the production of complete motorcycles more than 50 years ago. Their very first engine block was designed on the basis of the technical knowledge gained during the development and design of aircraft engines.

They started producing motorcycles with one single goal in mind: to develop new techniques. Over the years they have therefore introduced a large number of models that changed the entire motorcycle world. At the same time, they made legendary motorcycles, many of which are still in everyone's memory, especially for the (at the time) astonishing power and unprecedented speed. In 1996, they passed the 10 million motorcycle mark, a testament to their versatile offering and encouragement to continue developing legendary engines.

The aim of this project is to realize 1 product information source system for the entire European market. Each country is itself responsible for assortment selection, localized product descriptions, price information and composition of accessory collections.

Primary role:
- Lead architect for implementing inRiver PIM as source system for marketing departments and company websites (Adobe Experience Cloud).
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Determine project scope and implementation costs
- Organize and lead workshops and trainings
- Design of PIM model, PIM system extensions and local market model introduction workflow
- Devise solutions for labor-intensive product management activities such as transitions to new model year of vehicles
- Team lead for implementation

Secondary role:
- Platform integration support (Adobe AEM (CMS), Lytho DAM, IBM data warehouse)
- Support on migrating product data from their currently used CMS system to inRiver PIM

projects.title: Boretti PIM implementation
projects.description:
Boretti was founded in 1995 and has grown into a household name in the lifestyle kitchen industry with kitchen appliances in the high segment. The kitchen lifestyle brand is distinguished by excellent quality and affordable Italian design.

The Boretti collection is designed in Italy and produced by Italian family businesses. These roots ensure that Boretti is committed to excellent quality. The taste of the Italians, the passion with which they live life and the leading role that qualitative Italian design plays worldwide are core values ​​that Boretti propagates in all its products.

Boretti quickly developed into a permanent fixture in the kitchen landscape. Originally they started making stoves, the first of which was produced in 1995, and became a huge success. After the stoves, Boretti expanded with indoor and outdoor kitchen appliances. Small household products now also belong to the collection. Unique is the custom-made service, because a Boretti, in a color of your choice, fits perfectly in every kitchen.

Primary role:
- Lead architect for implementing inRiver PIM as source system for product development, company websites and eCommerce platforms like Channable and ShopifyPlus
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Determine project scope and implementation costs
- Organize and lead workshops and trainings
- Design of PIM model, PIM system extensions and toll-gate based product development workflow
- Team lead for implementation

Secondary role:
- Platform integration support (Exact ERP, Apollo datagraph platform, Channable, ShopifyPlus, inRiver Syndication)
- Support on migrating product data from their currently used CMS system to inRiver PIM

projects.title: apetito AG PIM analysis
projects.description:
Since 1958, apetito AG (Rheine, Germany) has been working on the best nutritional solutions for people in different eating and living situations. Today they can proudly call themselves catering specialist and a market and innovation leader in the public catering sector and in the consumer market (today, around 1.3 million people eat apetito dishes every day). They owe this to their clear goals and firm values ​​such as customer proximity, sustainability and innovativeness.

apetito AG is replacing their currently used software solution to be able to expand their fast growing business in Europe. They chose inRiver PIM because this system fits perfectly with their marketing model, is completely cloud-based and works in an intuitive and user-friendly way. Part of the project is integrating inRiver PIM with many eCommerce platforms and their PLM, ERP, DAM and ESB systems .

Primary role:
- Advise on using inRiver PIM as data source for multiple lines of business
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Determine project scope and implementation costs
- Organize and lead workshops
- Lead architect of PIM model & PIM system customizations
- Implementation support

Secondary role:
- Platform integration support

projects.title: Atlas Copco Airpower PIM proof-of-concept
projects.description:
Atlas Copco -founded in 1873- is an industry-leading provider of sustainable productivity solutions, operating in 180 countries and providing nationwide sales, service and distribution of gas and air compressors, aeration blowers, air dryers, filters, air receivers, pipework, nitrogen & oxygen generators.

Today, Atlas Copco’s Airpower facility in Belgium (Antwerp) is the world’s largest and most advanced manufacturing site for both portable and stationary compressors, employing around 2600 people. It is the head office of Atlas Copco’s business area Compressor Technique. Atlas Copco’s Compressor Technique business area develops, manufactures, markets, and services oil-free and oil-injected stationary air compressors, portable air compressors, gas and process compressors, turbo expanders, electric power generators, air treatment equipment and air management systems. It innovates for superior productivity in applications such as manufacturing, construction, and the process industry worldwide.

Atlas Copco Airpower is investigating the functionality the inRiver PIM platform offers to create, maintain and quickly deploy commercial product information of their extensive product assortment. Part of the proof-of-concept project is workflow driven instant generation of product brochures, integrating inRiver PIM with MS-SharePoint (product brochure storage and tagging) and easy maintenance of complex product performance data. 

Primary role:
- Advise on using inRiver PIM as data source for product brochure generation and maintenance system for complex product performance data
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Organize and lead workshops
- Lead architect of PIM model, PIM system extensions and workflow
- Implementation support

Secondary role:
- Platform integration support
- Support on migrating product data from their currently used data source to inRiver PIM

projects.title: Reynaers Aluminium PIM implementation
projects.description:
For over 50 years, Reynaers Aluminium has been designing cutting-edge glazing solutions for some of the most iconic buildings in the world. Engineered without compromise, our ranges of aluminium windows, doors and curtain wall systems have been specified time and again by the world’s leading architects and construction companies.

As well as their wide range of standard aluminium glazing products, they also develop tailor-made solutions for all market sectors – from private domestic to high-rise residential and commercial to industrial. Their high-quality aluminium glazing products meet the most stringent demands in terms of comfort, security, architectural design, and energy-efficiency. Reynaers is not only a supplier, but also a valuable partner— for architects, fabricators, project developers, investors and end users.

Reynaers is replacing their currently used DAM/PIM system to be able to expand their fast growing business worldwide. They chose inRiver PIM because this system fits perfectly with their marketing model, is completely cloud-based and works in an intuitive and user-friendly way. Part of the project is integrating inRiver PIM with ShowPad (sales support tool), Reynaers glocal website + all localized websites and their product configurator tool.

Primary role:
- Advise on using inRiver PIM as data source for ShowPad, worldwide (localized) websites and product configuration tools
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Determine project scope and implementation costs
- Organize and lead workshops
- Lead architect of PIM model and PIM system extensions
- Implementation support

Secondary role:
- Platform integration support
- Support on migrating product data from their currently used PIM system to inRiver PIM

projects.title: Hans Anders PIM implementation
projects.description:
Hans Anders was founded in 1982 and is a successful value-for-money retailer in glasses, contact lenses and hearing aids, with high quality for an always competitive price. Hans Anders, part of the group, is the market leader in the Netherlands and has more than 400 stores in the Netherlands and Belgium. In Sweden, the Hans Anders Retailgroup operates under the Direkt Optik brand, with 40 stores. The Eyes + More chain, with 170 stores in Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium and Austria, is also part of the Hans Anders Retail Group.

Hans Anders is currently developing a new online architecture that will help them to further expand customer-focused services. Part of this process is the introduction of a PIM system.

The implementation of PIM will help Hans Anders to create one single source of truth of their growing product assortment. Part of the project is integrating inRiver PIM with their ERP system (SAP), website and POS system (AXI).

Primary role:
- Advice on the transition from article based to product-article based information management
- Analyze business requirements and advice stakeholders in moving product features from ERP to PIM
- Determine project scope and implementation costs
- Organize and lead workshops
- Lead architect of PIM model
- Implementation support

Secondary role:
- Platform integration support
- Support on migrating product data from their ERP system to inRiver PIM

projects.title: Purmo Group PIM extension
projects.description:
Rettig ICC is majority-owned by Purmo Group Ltd, a Finnish family-run business that creates value for generations through sustainable and long-term growth. Rettig ICC is Europe's biggest and most profitable producer of heat emitter solutions. Growth comes from new and related market segments. Rettig ICC has offices in Finland, Sweden, UK, ireland, Belgium, France, Germany, Poland, Austria, Hungary and Turkey.

Rettig ICC started with inRiver PIM in 2018. During the analysis phase, Rettig ICC recognized the importance of ETIM classification of their products. Because Ctac offers an ETIM extension fully integrated with inRiver PIM, Rettig has opted for this solution. Part of this solution includes an outbound interface for datapools like 2BA (Netherlands) and InstallData (Belgium).

Primary Role:
- Organize workshop for training PIM implementation team
- Review of current PIM model and advice on improvements 
- Lead architect PIM marketing model extension for ETIM
- Implementation and data migration support including 2BA/InstallData datapool connectivity

projects.title: Go-Tan PIM migration
projects.description:
Go-tan is a family business with a passion for Eastern cuisine. Their motto speaks for itself: A very foodloving family. Most of their products are manufactured in their modern factory in the Netherlands and delivered to the European market.

Go-Tan started with inRiver PIM in 2016. This year they decided to migrate to inRiver's SAAS version iPMC. Project includes data migration and deployment of new inbound/outbound interfaces including GS1 Data Source. 

Primary role:
- Advice and guidance requirements analysis based on new insights
- Lead consultant PIM migration project
- Implementation and data migration support

projects.title: Fetim Group PIM migration
projects.description:
Fetim Group is a leading company in home improvement products. For almost a century, they have been devoting their passion to improve peoples homes with innovative products. Product expertise covers window decoration, shelving & storage, flooring, (technical) sanitary and building supplies. Based in the Netherlands, but with offices in the UK, Belgium, Germany, France, Switzerland, Spain and Hong Kong, they operate as a globally connected and diversified company.

Fetim Group started with inRiver PIM in 2016. This year they decided to migrate to inRiver's SAAS version iPMC. Project includes partly re-design of the PIM marketing model (based on new insights), data migration and deployment of new inbound/outbound interfaces. 

Primary role:
- Advice and guidance requirements analysis based on new insights
- Organize and lead workshops
- Lead architect PIM marketing model re-design
- Implementation and data migration support

projects.title: Buzzispace PIM implementation
projects.description:
BuzziSpace is relentless in its pursuit of bettering the world through design. It started with acoustics. From there, the mission grew. Driven by an unbounded passion for solving modern design challenges, BuzziSpace continuously re-imagines furnishings to be more functional and more fun. The brand provides new ways of working, living and being sustainable. BuzziSpace continuously strives for durable and high quality products which is reflected in their production process. Buzzispace has manufacturing units in the Netherlands (Bladel) and the US (North Carolina – High Point). Their passionate craftsmen are constantly taking products to a higher level and bringing that extra sparkle to their product families.

Buzzispace is currently developing a new online architecture that will help them to further expand customer-focused services, apply innovative marketing methods and improve operational performance. Part of this process is the introduction of a PIM system and an online product configurator.

The implementation of PIM will help Buzzispace to create one single source of truth of all their product information. Using the product information captured in PIM Buzzispace website visitors will be able to navigate in a sophisticated way e.g. product-, problem solution- and inspiration-based. Part of the project is integrating inRiver PIM with Buzzispace's ERP / DAM / product configurator / website using Dell Boomi iPaas platform.

Primary role:
- Advise on getting the best out of PIM in an omni-channel environment
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Determine project scope and implementation costs
- Organize and lead workshops
- Lead architect of PIM model
- Implementation support

Secondary role:
- Dell Boomi iPaas platform integration support

projects.title: EDCO wholesale PIM implementation
projects.description:
EDCO is a stock holding wholesale company delivering 20.000 products from stock. EDCO carries a large number of product lines under its own brand. Every brand has a distinct and well-designed packaging line. They deliver private-label products to a number of customers. Renowned A-brands such as Grundig, Kinzo, Penn, Duracell, Telefunken, Snoke and All Ride are also part of their assortment.

This PIM implementation will replace EDCO's current 'tailormade' applications used for supporting their product lifecycle management processes. EDCO has choosen inRiver's Product Marketing Cloud (iPMC) solution for supporting their purchasing / package design / product data enrichment / manufacturing and marketing processes. inRiver's integrated workflow and notification system is used for control of data readiness. inRiver's integrated print features will be used for creating product flyers and catalogs.

Part of the project is integrating inRiver PIM with EDCO's ERP / DAM / customs / eCommerce systems using Dell Boomi iPaas platform.

Primary role:
- Advise on getting the best out of PIM in an omni-channel environment
- Advice and guidance regarding changing business processes
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Organize and lead workshops
- Lead architect of PIM model
- Implementation support

Secondary role:
- Dell Boomi iPaas platform integration support

projects.title: Tectum Group PIM implementation
projects.description:
Tectum Group is a wholesaler and a service provider for the building industry. The company is expert in roof, façade and balustrade construction in Belgium and the Netherlands. The group employs over 400 professionals at 23 locations and their headquarter is located in Genk, Belgium.

Tectum Group maintains a large assortment distributed via 6 logistics distribution centers. To be able to describe all product characteristics in detail, inRiver PIM was choosen as their new product information management platform. Using inRiver's Product Marketing Cloud (iPMC) solution, Tectum Group is now able to:
- Offer their sales department extensive and up-to-date product data including ERP stock and price information
- Publish product data to their printed product catalog
- Publish product data to datapools focusing primarily on installation industry
- Classify all their products using the ETIM classification industry standard
- Offer a product store to their customers containing all relevant product information including product images, manuals, installation instructions, test reports etc.

Primary role:
- Advise on getting the best out of PIM in an omni-channel environment
- Lead architect of PIM model, ETIM classification extension and external interfaces
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Determine project scope and implementation costs
- Organize and lead workshops
- Implementation support

Secondary role:
- Supporting third parties with e-commerce channel integration

projects.title: Coram International PIM extension
projects.description:
Coram International is to be a significant player in the sanitation sector. The company develops accessories and integrated solutions with an emphasis on design and innovation. Brands include Geesa, Tiger, Sealskin, Esbada and Impey. Coram among other things, provides the retail-professional, Do-It-Yourself (DIY) and many e-commerce channels.

Coram has contracted Ctac as their new partner for expanding their existing InRiver PIM system  with new functionality, interfaces with additional e-commerce channels and preparation for new business developments.

Primary role:
- Advise on getting the best out of PIM in an omni-channel environment
- Lead architect of PIM model, ETIM/GS1 classification extension and external interfaces
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Organize and lead workshops
- Participate / advise on new business challenges
- Implementation support

Secondary role:
- Supporting third parties with e-commerce channel integration

contributors.headline: Business Unit Manager Data Service at Ctac

projects.title: B&C window decoration PIM implementation
projects.description:
B&C Window decoration is the leading manufacturer behind the brand bece®. They manufacture custom-made window decorations for different countries in Europe, and for the United States and Canada. The Danish organization Stila is also part of the company. Products offered by B&C include roller-, pleated-, venetian-, roman- and vertical-blinds as well as curtains and panel tracks.

To be able to maintain all product characteristics for their online product configurator utility and  all commercial aspects for catalog use from 1 environment, B&C has choosen inRiver PIM as their product information management platform. 

Primary role:
- Lead architect of product configurator ready PIM model and external interfaces
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Determine project scope and implementation costs
- Organize and lead workshops
- Implementation support

Secondary role:
- Supporting third parties with e-commerce channel integration

projects.title: Muelink & Grol Group PIM implementation
projects.description:
M&G Group is the world’s leading manufacturer of flue gas venting and ventilation systems. The company has extensive knowledge of relevant legislation in Europe and North America. The group employs over 1.200 professionals at 12 locations and their headquarter is located in Assen, The Netherlands.

M&G group assortment counts over 12.000 products. To be able to describe all product characteristics in detail, inRiver PIM was choosen as their new product information management platform. Using inRiver PIM, M&G group is now able to:
- Publish product data to their online product catalog
- Publish product data to datapools (2BA and artikelbeheer.nl) focusing primarily on installation industry
- Classify all their products using the ETIM classification industry standard
- Offer a product store to their customers containing all relevant product information including product images, manuals, test reports etc.

Primary role:
- Advise on getting the best out of PIM in an omni-channel environment
- Lead architect of PIM model, ETIM classification extension and external (BMECat) interfaces
- Collect and analyze business requirements
- Determine project scope and implementation costs
- Organize and lead workshops
- Implementation support

Secondary role:
- Supporting third parties with e-commerce channel integration

projects.title: inRiver PIM ETIM classification extension
projects.description:
ETIM is a classification standard for the construction and installation industry. To easily comply with the ETIM standard, I have developed an extension for inRiver PIM. This makes the ETIM method easier, faster and more efficient in one fell swoop. Users do not have to worry about ETIM updates because the extension updates classification changes fully automatically.

Advantages of the ETIM extension:
- Fully industry standard compliant
- Limitation of product data errors
- Full support for dynamic classification updates

My role was to design and implement the inRiver PIM solution which included:
- Architectural design of the inRiver PIM extension according to ETIM standards
- Design of inRiver PIM marketing model adjustments
- Design of inbound/outbound channel integrations (e.g. Excel ETIM data import/export, BMEcat based datapool interface, INSBOU import interface) 
- Managing the development- and test-team
- Documentation and user manuals
- Field support

projects.title: Discus pet shop PIM implementation
projects.description:
Discus is a cooperative organization with approximately 135 affiliated pet shops. These Discus shops are run by independent entrepreneurs who want to realize their ambitions with a progressive and critical eye.
 
To maintain the product information of the extensive range of Discus products and use of this information in an omni-channel environment, Discus has chosen inRiver PIM. Discus has chosen Ctac as their implementation partner because of the expertise Ctac offers on eCommerce solutions and their broad experience in the retail/wholesale market.
 
My role was to design and implement the inRiver PIM solution which included:
- organizing workshops to capture requirements
- design of inRiver PIM marketing model
- design of inbound/outbound channel integrations
- enable print functionality using Adobe InDesign
- design customizations
- support Discus organization during acceptance test and rollout phase

InRiver PIM solution successfully went live in December 2016

contributors.headline: Business Unit Manager Data Service at Ctac

projects.title: DAF Trucks consolidated invoicing
projects.description: Project is aimed at the unburdening of DAF fleet customers by offering consolidated invoicing. Phase 1 of this project is realized in an agile way of working (Scrum). As an information analyst I've helped the product owner with capturing requirements for the product backlog (using Microsoft Team Foundation Services) and detailing user stories. As a Scrum master I facilitated the team organizing sprint planning sessions, retrospectives, burndown chart support and more.

projects.title: DAF Trucks information analyst warranty / workshop order management
projects.description:
Dealer Claim Entry (DCE) is DAF's global used web-based warranty management / service management / claim management system offering functions like:
- Registration of truck and trailer workshop orders (maintenance and repair jobs)
- Automated generation of vehicle type based job consumption
- Automated dealer based part / labor price calculation
- Integrated maintenance planner with automated job generation and notification
- Claim support for all contracted vehicles e.g. warranty contracts and R&M contracts
- Automated claim validation / claim assessment support 
- Third party dealer management system (DMS) interface ready
- Interfaces with many company wide devisions e.g. claim assessment department, contract management department, part return department and financial settlement department

Primary role:
- Collecting and analyzing business / user requirements
- Modelling business processes
- Describing use cases and defining user interface
- Defining interfaces for third party systems and external data sources
- Support of the software development team

Secondary role:
- Knowledge sharing / coaching / DCE product expert
- Participating in new business challenges
- Extending DCE by adding business value (continious improvement)
